snippet: Pat Haden, Southern California’s athletic director and a member of the College Football Playoff selection committee, argued with referees in an incident that spurred debate over the committee’s role.
abstract: Marc Tracy On College Football column; University of Southern California athletic director Pat Haden, who is also a member of College Football Playoff selection committee, argues with referees during USC's 13-10 victory over Stanford, spurring debate about committee's role; there are no established principles, but such actions are considered bad form.
lead_paragraph: Pat Haden, Southern California’s athletic director and a member of the College Football Playoff selection committee, argued with referees in an incident that spurred debate over the committee’s role.

headline.seo: Pat Haden Draws Scrutiny to College Football Playoff Committee
headline.main: Questions of Bracket Biases After a U.S.C. Leader’s Outburst
headline.print_headline: Questions of Bracket Biases After a U.S.C. Leader’s Outburst
